remarks: The metric function of a metric space is always continuous in the topology generated by it.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)
statement:
xmetdcn2.1 $e |- J = ( MetOpen ` D ) $.
xmetdcn2.2 $e |- C = ( dist ` RR*s ) $.
xmetdcn2.3 $e |- K = ( MetOpen ` C ) $.
metdcn.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( *Met ` X ) ) $.
metdcn.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. X ) $.
metdcn.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. X ) $.
metdcn.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
metdcn.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. X ) $.
metdcn.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. X ) $.
metdcn.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( A D Y ) < ( R / 2 ) ) $.
metdcn.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( B D Z ) < ( R / 2 ) ) $.
metdcnlem $p |- ( ph -> ( ( A D B ) C ( Y D Z ) ) < R ) $.
